title: Can I be held liable if I marry a person that owes back child support
question: Is i marry a man in california and he owes backchild support.Will we have to create a prenup for my bank account protection?Or will they take being that we are married and will the prenup help during our marriage for this?
question_tags: Divorce,Bank accounts in divorce,Divorce and joint accounts,Dividing debts in a divorce,Community property in divorce,Child support,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Joint accounts during bankruptcy,Debt,Nondischargeable debt and child support,Bankruptcy and debt,Divorce and family,Child support arrears,Family law
answers: Yes, a pre-nup will help you. Find an experienced family law atorney, one who has prepared a LOT of these agreements. Be very up front with the lawyer and ask specific questions about the number of these agrements they have prepared. Pay the extra cost associated with hiring an expert; it will be worth it in the long run. Good luck with this matter.

California is a community property state so assets acquired / debts incurred by a spounse prior to the date of marriage is separate. However, if you establish a joint account there is a possibility that a judgment could attach to that account leaving you in a position of having to bear the burden and expense of defending your stake in such account.
